info.title: Developer API
info.description:
Welcome! On this page you'll find the definitions for the MTD Developer API. This API provides data on MTD operations (routes, stops, vehicles, etc.) in a standard RESTful format. All endpoints return data in JSON. The methods are geared towards retrieving small, specific collections of data regarding our services. Much of the data is identical to our GTFS feed, but it also includes some extra features like real-time departures and stop search autocomplete. For more information on this API, and to get a required API key, visit developer.mtd.org.
Be sure to check out our General Transit Specification Feed (GTFS) at https://developer.mtd.org/gtfs. GTFS is the industry standard for representing transit service as data, and contains even more information than this API provides!

get.summary: Get all route groups in the system.

sortNumber.description: Number used to sort the routes in a logical order. This is NOT the route number. Lower numbers should be shown first on lists.

color.description: Hex color code used to represent this route. # sign is omitted. Example: "FF0000"

textColor.description: Hex color code used for text when used on top of the route Color. # sign is omitted. Example: "FF0000"

firstTrip.description: The time of the first trip of the day for this route. Day is arbitary and used to convey time only.

lastTrip.description: The time of the last trip of the day for this route. Day is arbitary and used to convey time only.

lastTripAfterMidnight.description: True if the last trip of the day is after midnight.

dayType.description: The days and times of day this route is active.

timepart.description: The time of day. Examples: "Day", "Night", "Late Night", "Non-UI Day"

daysOfWeek.description: A zero-indexed list of ints representing the days of the week this daytype is active. 0=Sunday, 1=Monday, 2=Tuesday, 3=Wednesday, 4=Thursday, 5=Friday, 6=Saturday. Examples: "1,2,3,4,5" for weekdays only, "0,6" for weekends only.

sortOrder.description: Number used to sort the daytypes in a logical order. Lower numbers should be shown first on lists.

items.description: A route object. Represents a fixed route with a specific route number and daytype. Comparable to a page of the printed Maps and Schedules book.
The broadest classification of a route. Essentially, grouped by the color. Examples: "Red", "Lavender", "Illini"

get.summary: Get all active stops in the system.
get.description: By default a list of stop groups with all associated boarding points will be returned.

isStation.description: True if this stop is a station/terminal rather than a typical street stop.

city.description: City or municipality name. (Champaign, Urbana, or Savoy

subName.description: The sub name for this location. Generally the corner of the boarding point. (e.g., "SE Corner"). Should be combined with the group name for display.

stopCode.description: The 4-digit stop-code associated with this stop. This code is displayed on bus stop signs.

url.description: Link to the stop info page for this stop.

isAccessible.description: True if wheelchair boarding is possible at this stop. False if not. Null if unknown.

items.description: A specific boarding location under a group stop (e.g., "Green & Wright (SE Corner)".

boardingPoints.description: The child boarding points under this group.

stopCode.description: The 4-digit stop-code associated with this stop. This code is displayed on bus stop signs.

url.description: Link to the stop info page for this stop.

isAccessible.description: True if wheelchair boarding is possible at this stop. False if not. Null if unknown.

items.description: A grouped stop, usually an intersection (e.g., "Green & Wright"), which can contain multiple boarding points.

get.summary: Get scheduled stop times serving a stop.

stopId.description: The StopId of the bus stop this StopTime belongs to.

tripId.description: The TripId this StopTime belongs to.

stopSequence.description: The sequential order of this stop within the trip, 0-indexed.

arrivalTime.description: The time the bus is scheduled to arrive at the stop. This may differ from when the bus departs!

arrivalPastMidnight.description: True if this arrival is past midnight on a trip that began before midnight.

departureTime.description: The time the bus is scheduled to depart from the stop. By convention, this is the time that should be shown in public-facing passenger information.

departurePastMidnight.description: True if this departure is past midnight on a trip that began before midnight.

stopHeadsign.description: TODO? what is this. used on Vet-Med

items.description: An individual stop time, containing details about bus arrival and departure times.

get.summary: Get all routes that serve this stop.

sortNumber.description: Number used to sort the routes in a logical order. This is NOT the route number. Lower numbers should be shown first on lists.

color.description: Hex color code used to represent this route. # sign is omitted. Example: "FF0000"

textColor.description: Hex color code used for text when used on top of the route Color. # sign is omitted. Example: "FF0000"

firstTrip.description: The time of the first trip of the day for this route. Day is arbitary and used to convey time only.

lastTrip.description: The time of the last trip of the day for this route. Day is arbitary and used to convey time only.

lastTripAfterMidnight.description: True if the last trip of the day is after midnight.

dayType.description: The days and times of day this route is active.

timepart.description: The time of day. Examples: "Day", "Night", "Late Night", "Non-UI Day"

daysOfWeek.description: A zero-indexed list of ints representing the days of the week this daytype is active. 0=Sunday, 1=Monday, 2=Tuesday, 3=Wednesday, 4=Thursday, 5=Friday, 6=Saturday. Examples: "1,2,3,4,5" for weekdays only, "0,6" for weekends only.

sortOrder.description: Number used to sort the daytypes in a logical order. Lower numbers should be shown first on lists.

items.description: A route object. Represents a fixed route with a specific route number and daytype. Comparable to a page of the printed Maps and Schedules book.
The broadest classification of a route. Essentially, grouped by the color. Examples: "Red", "Lavender", "Illini"
